body_html:
As @reedwm already pointed out, the higher CPU utilization arises because there is more work for the CPU to do per batch, including file I/O, protocol buffer parsing, JPEG decoding, distortions, and so on.

I'm not sure what your basis is for the statement "it still not necessary to cost so much CPU resources". Almost all of the low hanging fruit has been picked, although you might want to upgrade from TensorFlow 1.4.2 to TensorFlow 1.8, as the team has improved many of the operations in the input pipeline, and I'd expect CPU utilization to decrease with an upgrade. Nevertheless, the baseline for utilization will inherently be higher than the synthetic data case.

body:
As @reedwm already pointed out, the higher CPU utilization arises because there is more work for the CPU to do per batch, including file I/O, protocol buffer parsing, JPEG decoding, distortions, and so on.

I'm not sure what your basis is for the statement "it still not necessary to cost so much CPU resources". Almost all of the low hanging fruit has been picked, although you might want to upgrade from TensorFlow 1.4.2 to TensorFlow 1.8, as the team has improved many of the operations in the input pipeline, and I'd expect CPU utilization to decrease with an upgrade. Nevertheless, the baseline for utilization will inherently be higher than the synthetic data case.
